title: InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS
content:
View CSAF

Summary

Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities may allow remote code execution.

The following versions of InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS are affected:

  • MasterSCADA BUK-TS vers:all/* (CVE-2026-21410, CVE-2026-22553)
CVSS Vendor Equipment Vulnerabilities
v3 9.8 InSAT InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection'), Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

Background

  • Critical Infrastructure Sectors: Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Water and Wastewater
  • Countries/Areas Deployed: Worldwide
  • Company Headquarters Location: Russia

Vulnerabilities

Expand All +

CVE-2026-21410

InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS is susceptible to SQL Injection through its main web interface. Malicious users that use the vulnerable endpoint are potentially able to cause remote code execution.

View CVE Details

Affected Products

InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS
Vendor:
InSAT
Product Version:
InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS: vers:all/*
Product Status:
known_affected
Remediations

Mitigation
InSAT has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate these vulnerabilities. Users of the affected products are encouraged to contact info@insat.ru or scada@insat.ru for additional information.

Mitigation
InSAT has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate these vulnerabilities. Users of the affected products are encouraged to contact info@insat.ru or scada@insat.ru for additional information.

Relevant CWE: CWE-89 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')

Metrics

CVSS Version Base Score Base Severity Vector String
3.1 9.8 CRITICAL CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

CVE-2026-22553

All versions of InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS are susceptible to OS command injection through a field in its MMadmServ web interface. Malicious users that use the vulnerable endpoint are potentially able to cause remote code execution.

View CVE Details

Affected Products

InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS
Vendor:
InSAT
Product Version:
InSAT MasterSCADA BUK-TS: vers:all/*
Product Status:
known_affected
Remediations

Mitigation
InSAT has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate these vulnerabilities. Users of the affected products are encouraged to contact info@insat.ru or scada@insat.ru for additional information.

Mitigation
InSAT has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate these vulnerabilities. Users of the affected products are encouraged to contact info@insat.ru or scada@insat.ru for additional information.

Relevant CWE: CWE-78 Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

Metrics

CVSS Version Base Score Base Severity Vector String
3.1 9.8 CRITICAL CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Acknowledgments

  • Adem El Adeb reported these vulnerabilities to CISA

Legal Notice and Terms of Use

This product is provided subject to this Notification (https://www.cisa.gov/notification) and this Privacy & Use policy (https://www.cisa.gov/privacy-policy).

Recommended Practices

CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities, such as:

Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.

Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.

When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as the connected devices.

CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.

CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.

Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.

Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.

No known public exploitation specifically targeting these vulnerabilities has been reported to CISA at this time.

Revision History

  • Initial Release Date: 2026-02-24
Date Revision Summary
2026-02-24 1 Initial Publication

Legal Notice and Terms of Use
summary:
### Executive Overview
러시아 기반의 InSAT사가 개발한 MasterSCADA BUK-TS 솔루션에서 원격 코드 실행(RCE)이 가능한 두 개의 치명적인 취약점이 발견되었습니다. 이 시스템은 제조, 에너지, 수처리 등 전 세계 핵심 인프라 분야에서 광범위하게 사용되고 있어, 공격 성공 시 국가 기반 시설의 중단이나 물리적 피해를 야기할 수 있는 심각한 위협으로 간주됩니다. 특히 제조사가 CISA의 보안 권고 및 완화 조치 협력 요청에 응답하지 않고 있어, 현재 공식적인 패치가 존재하지 않는 제로데이(Zero-day) 상태에 가깝습니다.

### Threat Analysis
이번에 식별된 위협은 CVE-2026-21410(SQL 인젝션)과 CVE-2026-22553(OS 커맨드 인젝션)으로 구성됩니다. CVE-2026-21410은 메인 웹 인터페이스의 취약한 엔드포인트를 통해 악의적인 SQL 명령을 주입함으로써 데이터베이스 탈취 및 RCE를 허용합니다. CVE-2026-22553은 MMadmServ 웹 인터페이스의 특정 필드에서 입력값 검증 미흡으로 발생하며, 공격자가 기본 운영 체제에서 직접 명령을 실행할 수 있게 합니다. 두 취약점 모두 CVSS 9.8의 높은 점수를 기록하며, 특권 권한 없이도 네트워크를 통해 공격이 가능합니다.

### Impact Assessment
본 취약점이 악용될 경우, 공격자는 SCADA 서버에 대한 완전한 제어권을 획득할 수 있습니다. 이는 단순히 데이터 유출에 그치지 않고, 산업 제어 시스템(ICS)을 조작하여 생산 라인 가동 중단, 전력망 차단, 또는 수처리 시설의 물리적 오작동을 유발할 수 있습니다. 전 세계적으로 배치된 장비 특성상 공급망 공격의 교두보가 될 위험이 크며, 특히 패치 부재로 인해 위협 노출 기간이 장기화될 것으로 우려됩니다.

### Recommendations
공식 패치가 배포될 때까지 조직은 즉각적인 방어 조치를 시행해야 합니다. 첫째, 모든 제어 시스템 장비를 인터넷에서 차단하고 네트워크 분리(Air-gapping)를 강화하십시오. 둘째, 원격 접속이 불가피한 경우 최신 버전의 VPN을 사용하되, 비즈니스 네트워크와 ICS 네트워크 사이에 엄격한 방화벽 정책을 적용하십시오. 셋째, MITRE ATT&CK T1190 기법에 대응하기 위해 웹 인터페이스 유입 트래픽에 대한 심층 패킷 분석(DPI) 및 침입 탐지 시스템(IDS) 룰을 업데이트할 것을 권고합니다.
references: Stouffer et al., Guide to Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Security, NIST Special Publication 800-82 Rev. 2, 2015
MITRE ATT&CK: T1190 - Exploit Public-Facing Application
